title: 105_hr859
content: SECTION 1. AMENDMENTS. The Energy Policy and Conservation Act is amended to make changes to various sections, including removing certain paragraphs and revising language related to showerheads, faucets, water closets, and urinals. The Energy Policy and Conservation Act is amended to remove paragraphs related to water use in showerheads, faucets, water closets, and urinals, and to revise language regarding ANSI standards. The Energy Policy and Conservation Act is amended to remove paragraphs related to water use in showerheads, faucets, water closets, and urinals, and to revise language regarding ANSI standards. This includes striking specific paragraphs and language related to water use and unit costs of water and wastewater treatment services. The Energy Policy and Conservation Act is amended to remove paragraphs related to water use in showerheads, faucets, water closets, and urinals, and to revise language regarding ANSI standards. This includes striking specific paragraphs and language related to water use and unit costs of water and wastewater treatment services. Amendments also involve removing references to measured water use and energy use in various subsections. The Energy Policy and Conservation Act is amended to remove references to water use in various appliances and revise language regarding ANSI standards. This includes striking specific paragraphs related to water use and unit costs of water and wastewater treatment services. Amendments also involve removing references to measured energy use in different subsections. The Energy Policy and Conservation Act is amended to remove references to water use in various appliances and revise language regarding ANSI standards. This includes striking specific paragraphs related to water use and unit costs of water and wastewater treatment services. Amendments also involve removing subsections and redesignating others. The Energy Policy and Conservation Act is amended to revise language regarding ANSI standards and remove references to water use in various appliances. This involves striking specific paragraphs related to water use and unit costs of water and wastewater treatment services, as well as removing subsections and redesignating others. The Energy Policy and Conservation Act is amended to revise language regarding ANSI standards and remove references to water use in various appliances. This involves striking specific paragraphs related to water use in subsections and redesignating others. The Energy Policy and Conservation Act is amended to revise language regarding ANSI standards and remove references to water use in various appliances. This involves striking specific paragraphs related to water use in subsections and redesignating others. In section 326, "or water use" is removed in subsection (b)(4), and in section 327, "consumption or water use" is struck. The Energy Policy and Conservation Act is amended to remove references to water use in various appliances by striking specific paragraphs related to water use in subsections and redesignating others. This includes revising language regarding ANSI standards and defining the term 'State regulation' in paragraph (2) of subsection (a). The Energy Policy and Conservation Act is amended to remove references to water use in various appliances by striking specific paragraphs related to water use in subsections and redesignating others. This includes revising language regarding ANSI standards and defining the term 'State regulation' in paragraph (2) of subsection (a). Amendments include removing regulations on showerheads and faucets, water closets, and urinals, and adjusting language in subsections (b) and (c). The Energy Policy and Conservation Act is amended to remove references to water use in various appliances by striking specific paragraphs related to water use in subsections and redesignating others. This includes revising language regarding ANSI standards and defining the term 'State regulation' in paragraph (2) of subsection (a). Amendments also involve removing regulations on showerheads and faucets, water closets, and urinals, and adjusting language in subsections (b) and (c). Additionally, paragraphs (4), (5), and (6) of subsection (c) are struck, along with certain phrases in subsection (d) related to river basin commissions and emergency conditions. The Energy Policy and Conservation Act is amended to remove references to water use in various appliances by striking specific paragraphs related to water use in subsections and redesignating others. This includes revising language regarding ANSI standards and defining the term 'State regulation' in paragraph (2) of subsection (a). Amendments also involve removing regulations on showerheads and faucets, water closets, and urinals, and adjusting language in subsections (b) and (c). Additionally, certain phrases in subsection (d) related to river basin commissions and emergency conditions are removed.
